alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:35AM EDT until April 30 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. At 18.0 feet, The Saluda River Campground including the Campground Store downstream from Chappells becomes flooded. Campers should move to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 17.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EDT.
